pullrequest.title: Remote server will hang if client uses and IP address that cannot be reached by the server.

content.raw:
2 seconds will usually be long enough, but in some cases, you might want to tolerate longer connection delays (e.g., connecting over a bad link to a slow cloud-hosted machine).  Can this timeout be increased to, say, 60 seconds?  If we can do that without blocking other operations (I can't tell from this file what control loop we're in), we should.

But if upping the delay qould cause blocking that would require code restructuring to avoid, leave the delay as is and we can look at it again later if somebody complains.
